intro: Eriogonum angulosum subsp. gracillimum, commonly known as the slender leaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces seeds in early summer. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
